text: But I do think we need better enforcement. There are a total of 40 SFPD traffic enforcement officers. For the whole city. It's no wonder stop signs are a joke, and that the majority of drivers speed. I live 100 feet from Bay, and am well aware that the average speed is 33 mph.

text: If you or someone else has an emergency you can certainly call 9-1-1 from a cell phone. In San Francisco, 9-1-1 calls from cell phones are answered by SF dispatchers unless you are on or near freeway. If so, the call will go to @CHPSanFrancisco.
text_html: If you or someone else has an emergency you can certainly call 9-1-1 from a cell phone. In San Francisco, 9-1-1 calls from cell phones are answered by SF dispatchers unless you are on or near freeway. If so, the call will go to @CHPSanFrancisco.

text: #NorthBeach Alert: After community feedback requesting additional on-site supervision & staffing at Joe DiMaggio Playground, I've received confirmation from @RecParkSF that we will expand on-site staffing until 6pm on most weekdays & add staffing from 9am-5pm Saturdays.
text_html: #NorthBeach Alert: After community feedback requesting additional on-site supervision & staffing at Joe DiMaggio Playground, I've received confirmation from @RecParkSF that we will expand on-site staffing until 6pm on most weekdays & add staffing from 9am-5pm Saturdays.

text: Huzzah! The 2019 Dignity Health CityBeat Poll, released Tuesday by the @SF_Chamber revealed that residents’ satisfaction w/ our Department is high & on the upswing! City dwellers who believe parks are improving jumped from 70% in 2018 to 78% in 2019. pic.twitter.com/CGlnLepbaS

text: Can you help with some info on what it will look like from thursday and going forward. I'm scheduled to fly to SF with my 6 month old daughter. Will the air be clean enough for her by then?
text_html: Can you help with some info on what it will look like from thursday and going forward. I'm scheduled to fly to SF with my 6 month old daughter. Will the air be clean enough for her by then?

text:
You have a good excuse.  San Francisco air went from unhealthy to very unhealthy on Thursday.  Forecasts for smoke in SF through Tuesday.  Friday is expected to be worse than Thursday.

Use your energy to check in with an elderly person or a neighbor with heart or lung disease
text_html: You have a good excuse. San Francisco air went from unhealthy to very unhealthy on Thursday. Forecasts for smoke in SF through Tuesday. Friday is expected to be worse than Thursday. Use your energy to check in with an elderly person or a neighbor with heart or lung disease

text: The smoke from firewood in a chimney isn't even one tree. This is millions of trees! Also the more in the air the more it creates a kind of blanket that keeps everything trapped underneath
text_html: The smoke from firewood in a chimney isn't even one tree. This is millions of trees! Also the more in the air the more it creates a kind of blanket that keeps everything trapped underneath

text:
@SFGate
It's worse in The East. I couldn't see Emeryville from the San Francisco Bay Bridge around 19:00 this evening. Yet around 22:00 there was a hint of a star over Lake Merritt. Right now in the Outer Mission it's very bad.
text_html: @SFGate It's worse in The East. I couldn't see Emeryville from the San Francisco Bay Bridge around 19:00 this evening. Yet around 22:00 there was a hint of a star over Lake Merritt. Right now in the Outer Mission it's very bad.

text: As a person with horrible asthma? What are some extra step I can take? I’ve been in my home with an air purifier all day and I just started vomiting from the nausea. I’m at a loss and getting worried

text: I never really understand people!!!  We burn firewood and we suck in firewood smoke outdoors from other chimneys up so close by. then we cry about forest fire smoke coming into our towns from afar.. Aren't they the same thing ?
text_html: I never really understand people!!! We burn firewood and we suck in firewood smoke outdoors from other chimneys up so close by. then we cry about forest fire smoke coming into our towns from afar.. Aren't they the same thing ?

text: The Mission Pool is closed today, 11/10 due to smoke from wildfires burning in Northern California. As of this morning, the air quality index in #SF was red, or unhealthy. The health & wellbeing of our swimmers & staff is our top priority & we have closed due to health concerns.pic.twitter.com/O0A7A970it
text_html: The Mission Pool is closed today, 11/10 due to smoke from wildfires burning in Northern California. As of this morning, the air quality index in #SF was red, or unhealthy. text: #earthday tip #2 from our Natural Areas staff: Be sure to stay on trails through our parks! Short-cutting trails or off-trail use can expose soils & cause erosion, resulting in plant & animal habitat loss! Make sure you hike a trail this weekend in our parks for #earthday2018 #sfpic.twitter.com/oYGLmeKaBW

text: In 1890, John McLaren, one of the most important men #SF Park history, became Park Superintendent or as he referred to himself "Boss Gardener." Hailing from Scotland, McLaren would serve 53 years as Superintendent until the age of 96, making #goldengatepark his life’s work.pic.twitter.com/9lpDALqcnL
text_html: In 1890, John McLaren, one of the most important men #SF Park history, became Park Superintendent or as he referred to himself "Boss Gardener." text: A fam on bikes in GGP today asked me for a safe route to the beach from JFK & Transverse.  "Excuse me - is this a safe road to the beach? Why did the bike lane just suddenly stop?" text: Another local hero from that day was Betty Ann Ong. She was  born and raised in SF, growing up in Chinatown & graduating from George Washington High School. She was a flight attendant on American Airlines Flight 11 on 9/11, the 1st flight hijacked. pic.twitter.com/wTkRX3uKU3
text_html: Another local hero from that day was Betty Ann Ong. She was born and raised in SF, growing up in Chinatown & graduating from George Washington High School. She was a flight attendant on American Airlines Flight 11 on 9/11, the 1st flight hijacked. pic.twitter.com/wTkRX3uKU3

text: In remembrance of 9/11, we look at one local hero who grew up in the Bay Area, Mark Bingham. He led passengers in a revolt against the hijackers on that day, which forced down the flight in Pennsylvania, 20 minutes from DC & potential targets of the White House/Capitol building. pic.twitter.com/2KXPyFAQbS
text_html: In remembrance of 9/11, we look at one local hero who grew up in the Bay Area, Mark Bingham. He led passengers in a revolt against the hijackers on that day, which forced down the flight in Pennsylvania, 20 minutes from DC & potential targets of the White House/Capitol building. pic.twitter.com/2KXPyFAQbS

text: We’re supposed to go tomorrow and seeing the air quality vary from yellow to red at night. Since Mather is for families with children, and children being a sensitive group, we’ve decided that we’re not going. A bummer, but we’ll try again next year.
text_html: We’re supposed to go tomorrow and seeing the air quality vary from yellow to red at night. Since Mather is for families with children, and children being a sensitive group, we’ve decided that we’re not going. A bummer, but we’ll try again next year.

text: Goats have returned to the Potrero Hill Community Garden! These goats from @CityGrazing are adept at navigating hilly/unstable ground, proving an efficient/environmentally friendly solution to invasive weeds. They’ll be out munching on the garden’s outskirts for roughly a week.pic.twitter.com/mlbAFE7yvs – at Potrero Hill Community Garden
text_html: Goats have returned to the Potrero Hill Community Garden! These goats from @CityGrazing are adept at navigating hilly/unstable ground, proving an efficient/environmentally friendly solution to invasive weeds. They’ll be out munching on the garden’s outskirts for roughly a week.pic.twitter.com/mlbAFE7yvs – at Potrero Hill Community Garden

text: The Rec & Park Commission approved the naming of the darkroom at Harvey Milk Photo Center in honor of David Johnson. He is a veteran, the 1st African American student of Ansel Adams & a documentarian who chronicled the lives of African Americans in the Fillmore from the 40s-60s. pic.twitter.com/Bsz5piidQS
text_html: The Rec & Park Commission approved the naming of the darkroom at Harvey Milk Photo Center in honor of David Johnson. He is a veteran, the 1st African American student of Ansel Adams & a documentarian who chronicled the lives of African Americans in the Fillmore from the 40s-60s. pic.twitter.com/Bsz5piidQS

text: In remembrance of September 11, 2001, we remember another local hero, Betty Ann Ong. She was born & raised in SF, growing up in Chinatown & graduating from Washington High School. Shoreline habitats?
Seriously?

#Priorities

text:
I've considered getting feedback from my running team & others aboutt potholes & to advocate for cars out of the park. Would be a bold move.

Honestly, it makes more sense to have multi-purpose paths. Humans deserve a greater share of the park's ambulatory space, that is all.

text: This is pathetic. GGP should be the *one* place we can go to get away from the death, destruction, and noise of cars but instead it's overrun with cars because motorists can park for free and cut through the park. And we're supposed to be happy it took 5 yrs to add bits of paint?

text: The existing car-free days, Bay to Breakers, big bike races, huge street fairs, all benefit from the openness. They could survive a narrower roadway but why constrain them and pick the political fight when it's unnecessary? A 1-side 2-way cycle track solves the parking problem.
text_html: The existing car-free days, Bay to Breakers, big bike races, huge street fairs, all benefit from the openness. They could survive a narrower roadway but why constrain them and pick the political fight when it's unnecessary? A 1-side 2-way cycle track solves the parking problem.

text:
I think ticks is the only real vote against living in the woods.

And ticks won’t steal stuff from your car, so they’re really not that bad.

But, come to think of it, they probably are shitting everywhere. It’s just cute, small shit.

426782 to 1

Asm @DavidChiu & I also secured another $4M from the #CABudget for the project.pic.twitter.com/SsJyM4AoN2

text: We met 92 percent of our park maintenance standards in fiscal year 2018/19, the latest Park Maintenance Standards Annual Report found. The score represents a 3 point increase from the previous 2 years & a 6 point increase over 4. It also exceeds its 90% target, set by the City https://twitter.com/RecParkSF/status/1205313099479150594 …
